meanings.definition: The shape or configuration of an object viewed from above.
meanings.sent1: The planforms of the city's layout were visible from the airplane window.
meanings.sent2: The architect drew detailed planforms of the building before construction began.
meanings.sent3: The planforms of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to fit them together.
meanings.sent4: Her dance movements created planforms in the air, like a graceful painting.
meanings.sent5: The planforms of the mountain range resembled giant waves frozen in time.

meanings.definition: A two-dimensional representation of an object or area.
meanings.sent1: The map displayed accurate planforms of the park's trails.
meanings.sent2: The artist sketched beautiful planforms of the landscape on paper.
meanings.sent3: The planforms on the blueprint helped the builders visualize the final structure.
meanings.sent4: The shadows cast by the planforms in the painting added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The planforms on the screen looked like a digital version of the real city.
